wikipedia_page.main:
Jason Calvin Pooley (born 8 August 1969 in Hammersmith, London) is a former cricketer, who represented Middlesex in the County Championship. Pooley is now retired from cricket.
A left-handed batsman, Pooley played 82 first-class matches and 103 List A matches.
"He did not appear after 1998, when he was in effect a one-day specialist, becoming the second team coach in which role he continued to appear for the 2nd XI. He was also assistant coach to John Emburey."Pooley's highest first-class score was 138* versus Cambridge University. His highest score against a county was 136, against Gloucestershire.Pooley now lives with his wife and three children. His brother, Gregg, played second XI cricket for a number of counties.

response: In 1995, after playing in his first season for English county Gloucestershire, Symonds won the Cricket Writer's Club Young Cricketer of the Year award. Shortly afterwards Symonds was selected as part of the England A team that was to tour Pakistan in the winter; however, he decided not to go, instead choosing to pursue an international career for Australia. His place on the tour was later taken by Middlesex player, Jason Pooley.
